item.title: 甲骨文考虑在印度尼西亚巴淡岛建立数据中心
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，甲骨文公司正在与印度尼西亚政府讨论在该国建立云服务中心的事宜，这家美国科技巨头正寻求扩大其在东南亚的数据中心布局。【原文：Oracle Corp. is in discussions with Indonesia’s government to establish a cloud services center in the country, people familiar with the matter said, as the US technology giant looks to expand its data center footprint in Southeast Asia.】

item.title: 刚果停产加剧短缺，锡延续LME最大涨势
item.description: 锡价延续涨势，非洲一个主要矿山停产继续推动伦敦金属交易所锡价创下今年最大涨幅。【原文：Tin prices extended gains, as a halt to production at a major mine in Africa continues to fan this year’s biggest rally on the London Metal Exchange.】

item.title: 面临美国关税风险，泰国希望年底前达成欧盟自由贸易协议
item.description: 泰国一位官员说，泰国希望在今年年底前结束与欧盟就期待已久的自由贸易协定进行的谈判，因为泰国希望在美国潜在的关税风险中加强经济安全。【原文：Thailand wants to wrap up talks with the European Union on a long-awaited free trade deal by the end of the year as it seeks to reinforce economic security amid potential tariff risks from the US, an official said.】

item.title: 中国政府计划发布消费简报，中国股市大涨
item.description: 中国的股票基准涨至今年以来的最高水平，其中消费类股票涨幅居前，因为人们预期该行业将获得更多的政策支持。【原文：China’s stock benchmark rallied to its highest level this year, with consumer shares leading gains on expectations of more policy support for the sector.】

item.title: 中国目前最大的挑战是如何花更多的钱
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的目标是在今年将美国政府的支出削减 1 万亿美元，而中国正面临着一个不同的问题：中国正努力花费足够的资金来让经济重新运转起来。【原文：As Elon Musk targets $1 trillion in cuts to the US government’s outlay this year, China is facing a different problem: It’s struggling to spend enough money to get the economy moving again.】

item.title: 科技股低迷，美国杠杆 ETF 不断吸引韩国买家
item.description: 本周，韩国投资者大举买入美国杠杆交易所交易基金，在市场陷入调整的颓势中继续投入这一热门交易。【原文：South Korean investors loaded up on US leveraged exchange-traded funds this week, continuing to plow into a popular trade amid a rout that has plunged the market into a correction.】

item.title: 莱茵哈特支持的矿商狮城公司认为价格抑制了新项目的发展
item.description: 澳大利亚亿万富翁吉娜-莱因哈特（Gina Rinehart）支持的锂矿开采商狮城资源有限公司（Liontown Resources Ltd.）在报告上半年业绩改善的同时警告说，关键电池金属的低价将对新项目造成压力。【原文：Liontown Resources Ltd., the lithium miner backed by Australian billionaire Gina Rinehart, warned that low prices for the key battery metal would weigh on new projects as it reported improved first-half results.】

item.title: 芬太尼为何成为中美贸易之争的焦点
item.description: 2 月 4 日，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对所有从中国进口的美国商品全面征收 10% 关税的行政命令正式生效。一个月后，他又将关税翻倍至 20%。【原文：On Feb. 4, President Donald Trump’s executive order imposing an across-the-board 10% tariff on all US imports from China went into effect. A month later, he doubled it to 20%.】

item.title: 贸易战一触即发，中国经济预计将展现韧性
item.description: 尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普上任后几乎立即与中国政府打响了第二场贸易战，但中国经济在今年前两个月可能表现出了稳定性。【原文：China’s economy likely showed stability in the first two months of the year, despite US President Donald Trump returning to office and almost instantly starting a second trade war with Beijing.】

item.title: 小米、吉利等中国电动汽车制造商在关税影响下仍表现出顽强的生命力
item.description: 小米公司（Xiaomi Corp.）、吉利汽车控股有限公司（Geely Automobile Holdings Ltd.）、NIO 公司（NIO Inc.【原文：Xiaomi Corp., Geely Automobile Holdings Ltd., NIO Inc. and Xpeng Inc. will show how resilient China’s electric-vehicle sector is to a stagnant domestic economy and tariffs in the US and European Union.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德警告贸易战将对全球造成严重影响
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德警告说，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普挑起的贸易征税争端升级可能会对世界经济造成不利影响。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde warned that an escalation of disputes over trade levies kicked off by US President Donald Trump may have a detrimental effect on the world economy.】

item.title: 日本国内生产总值增长影响 2% 的国防开支目标
item.description: 日本国内生产总值（GDP）的增长对该国来说听起来似乎是个好消息，但这也意味着它将不得不付出更多的代价来实现国防开支占 GDP 2% 的目标，这对于一个已经面临美国总统唐纳德-特朗普要求其提高军事产出压力的国家来说无疑是雪上加霜。【原文：The growth of Japan’s GDP may sound like good news for the country, but it also means it will have to pay more to reach its target to spend 2% of GDP on defense, adding to the woes of a nation already under pressure from US President Donald Trump to boost its military output.】

item.title: 尽管政策转向，新加坡货币市场利率仍在下滑
item.description: 由于新加坡中央银行五年来首次调整货币政策，新加坡货币市场利率下跌。【原文：Singapore’s money-market rates have dropped as traders shrug off the central bank’s first monetary policy shift in five years.】

item.title: US Soybean Cargoes Sail to China Despite Retaliatory Tariff
item.description: More than 30 cargoes of US soybeans are bound for China, with almost half expected to arrive after Beijing’s retaliatory tariffs on American farm goods come into effect next month, according to shipping data.

item.title: 越南贸易部长在关税忧虑中会见美国贸易部长
item.description: 越南最高贸易官员阮鸿献（Nguyen Hong Dien）希望保护越南免受特朗普可能征收关税的影响，他告诉美国贸易代表贾米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer），越南正在制定措施，以确保两国经济关系的 "可持续性"。【原文：Vietnam’s top trade official Nguyen Hong Dien, looking to protect the country from possible Trump tariffs, told US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer his country is developing measures to ensure “sustainable” economic relations between the two countries.】

item.title: 中国新碳排放权交易引发价格剧烈波动
item.description: 2017 年以来，中国发放的首批自愿碳信用额的交易价格波动剧烈。【原文：Trading of the first voluntary carbon credits issued in China since 2017 has delivered wild price swings.】

item.title: Citi, Apollo Test New Private Credit Tie-Up in Boeing Unit Sale
item.description: Citigroup Inc. and Apollo Global Management Inc. are offering potential buyers of Boeing Co.’s Jeppesen navigation unit the option to fund the acquisition via the pair’s nascent private credit partnership, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Samsung SDI to Sell $1.4 Billion New Shares for Battery Plants
item.description: Samsung SDI Co. will raise 2 trillion won ($1.4 billion) selling new shares to fund investments in US and European facilities as well as new technologies, as the battery maker bets on long-term growth of the electric-car industry.

item.title: Citi Sued by More Ex-Sales Traders Over 2019 Hong Kong Firing
item.description: Three former Citigroup Inc. equity sales traders filed wrongful termination claims against the US bank in Hong Kong this month, after a court in the city ruled that one of their ex-colleagues shouldn’t have been summarily dismissed in 2019.

item.title: Shein Remains Committed to IPO as Firm Weathers US Tariff Storm
item.description: Shein’s executive chairman said he remains committed to plans to take the fast-fashion retailer public despite being in the cross hairs of President Donald Trump’s campaign to rebalance global trade.

item.title: Oil Pares Weekly Loss as US Sanctions Offset Bleak IEA Outlook
item.description: Oil rose as fresh US sanctions against Iranian oil and shipping countered some of Thursday’s slump following a dour demand forecast from the IEA.

item.title: Crown Castle Sells Its Fiber Business for Combined $8.5 Billion
item.description: Telecommunications company Crown Castle Inc. has reached an agreement with an EQT AB fund and Zayo Group Holdings Inc. for each to buy separate parts of its fiber business for a combined value of $8.5 billion.

item.title: China Is ‘Laughing’ at US Trade Wars, EU Top Diplomat Says
item.description: China stands to gain from the ongoing trade wars between the US and its allies, the European Union’s foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas said in an interview with Bloomberg Television.

item.title: Peru Holds Key Rate as Policymakers Gauge Trade War Impact
item.description: Peru left interest rates unchanged on Thursday as policymakers try to gauge the inflationary impact of global trade wars.

item.title: CATL Shares Trail Most EV Battery Peers Ahead of Earnings Report
item.description: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. reports earnings details Friday that may provide useful clues for investors after its stock’s underperformance versus most electric-vehicle battery rivals this year.

item.title: Gold Hits Fresh Record as US Economic Fears Stoke Haven Demand
item.description: Gold rose to a record as President Donald Trump’s aggressive tariff agenda and a weak inflation report fanned fears about the outlook for US growth, driving investors to scoop up safer assets.

item.title: Asian Stocks to Fall as S&P Slides Into Correction: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asian equities faced downward pressure at the open on Friday after US stocks fell past a key milestone, weighed down by US President Donald Trump’s trade war.

item.title: China’s Bond Market Is Changing Its Tune on Japanification
item.description: Just a few months after China’s bond market was plagued by fears of Japanification, soaring yields are pointing to a stark shift in sentiment.

item.title: AIA to Buyback $1.6 Billion, New Business Value Misses Estimates
item.description: AIA Group Ltd. said it will start a $1.6 billion share buyback and reported a 17% growth in new business value last year that missed analyst estimates.

item.title: Stock Turmoil Spreads as Fear Hits the World of Corporate Bonds
item.description: As stocks stumbled in recent weeks, a cohort of Wall Street pros took solace as credit markets held firm and economic data proved benign.
